title: Need advice: what to use with Body Copy Sans?
content:
Thanks to all for your expertise. I'm a graphic designer; my focus was always more on illustration, but I've learned a LOT that I needed to learn about typography by lurking here.

Here's a question:  
A while back I bought Body Copy Sans Pro by Bergsland.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bergsland/body-copy-sans-pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720135056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bergsland/body-copy-sans-pro)  
It filled a gap in my text font collection; I had no "elegant" formal sans for such things as an invitation to a classy event; all were more utilitarian.

I use the font way less than I expected, because I'm uncertain what display or headline font to use with it. I'm concerned I'll choose something that clashes; contemporary display fonts don't look right at all.

What harmonizing headline font would you use with this body font if you wanted a distinctive, elegant look? What about Sigvar Bold?  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/softmaker/sigvar-serial](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720135056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/softmaker/sigvar-serial)

Or something like Bernhard Bold, even with the swash capitals?  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/bernhard-modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720135056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/bernhard-modern)

I was also considering one somewhat decorative with an Art Nouveau flavor, Letterhead Fancy Caps or Beaumarchais...Am I completely off base?  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/coffee-bin-fonts/letterhead](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720135056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/coffee-bin-fonts/letterhead)  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/beaumarchais](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720135056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/beaumarchais)

What about an upright script like Adore or Serena or even Pendulum?  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/adore](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720135056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/adore)  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/serena/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720135056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/serena/)  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/pendulum/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720135056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/pendulum/)

Thanks in advance for your help! ~ Dina
author: dinazina
